title: Israel strikes southern Lebanon killing 492 people
summary: More than 1,300 Hezbollah sites were targeted on Monday morning, the Israeli military said, despite international calls for restraint.

title: Telegram's Durov announces new crackdown on illegal content
summary: Staff has combed through Telegram using artificial intelligence to ensure "all the problematic content we identified in Search is no longer accessible," the billionaire said.

title: In Taiwan, fiction is being produced to prepare minds for a Chinese invasion
summary: The 'Zero Day' TV series, scheduled to air in 2025, realistically recounts the first week of a Chinese-led offensive against the island. It's a dark scenario that has provoked strong political reactions.

title: The great decline of European industry
summary: Industrial production is falling in most European Union countries, largely due to a lack of competitiveness with China and the US. The recent Draghi report has urged for significant investment to prevent the economy from 'stalling.'

title: JD Vance's very right-wing stance at Pennsylvania rally
summary: At a rally in the heart of that swing state for the November election, the Ohio politician methodically attacked the Democratic candidate in front of Republican activists united behind Donald Trump.

title: Marmosets call each other by the equivalent of a 'name,' study shows
summary: Israeli researchers have demonstrated that these little monkeys have an individual 'vocal label' that enables them to communicate with each other.

title: 'For some naturists, nudity can become a spiritual opportunity'
summary: Journalist Marc Bonomelli describes naturism 'as a means of radical self-expression as if the body were a channel for communicating the world's soul.' While this evolving practice dates back to antiquity, it's not without risk of abuse.

title: How the French far right is planning to take advantage of the Barnier government
summary: Able to block the new government at any time, Marine Le Pen wants to take advantage of the situation to wrest a few victories, however symbolic, from a prime minister who owes his reprieve only to concessions made to the far right.

title: Southern Brazil's Bolsonaro supporters are torn between nostalgia and moving forward
summary: In the town of Brusque, where voters will elect a municipal council on October 6, loyalty to conservative values is strong, but the former president's supporters are divided.

title: Sri Lanka elects a Marxist to lead a country shattered by five years of crisis
summary: The new president, Anura Kumara Dissanayake, embodies political renewal, two years after the citizens' revolution, whose aspirations he claims to carry forward.

title: New Caledonia on tenterhooks as major public holiday approaches
summary: Six thousand gendarmes, police and military personnel will be deployed across the archipelago to deter unrest on September 24, the day that marks the beginning of French colonization of the territory.

title: In Hungary, the hypocrisy of a homophobic priest is exposed
summary: Gergő Bese, an influential priest who relays the government's anti-LGBT propaganda extensively in the media, has been suspended from his duties after it was revealed that he participated in gay sex parties.

title: Paris department stores launch charm offensive
summary: New brands, store exclusives, vintage sections... Galeries Lafayette, Printemps and Le Bon Marché are making changes to lure back French customers.

title: In Paris, shutters are taking the heat from France's building architects
summary: Using external shutters is a simple and effective way of coping with heat waves. However, in the Paris region, the French national architectural advisory organization often refuse to allow them, in the name of heritage preservation.

title: After taking over the park, horses are now gracing the salons of Château de Versailles
summary: The site, which hosted the equestrian events of the Paris 2024 Olympic and Paralympic Games, is hosting a large exhibition about the animal's artistic representation.

title: Ukrainian President Zelensky begins US visit with ammunition factory to thank workers
summary: Volodymyr Zelensky will speak at the UN General Assembly annual gathering in New York on Tuesday and Wednesday and then travel to Washington for talks on Thursday with President Joe Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris.

title: Jean-Noël Barrot, a newcomer to France's foreign affairs ministry
summary: The promotion of the 41-year-old centrist, previously junior minister in charge of Europe, shows Emmanuel Macron's determination to keep a firm grip on his 'reserved domain.'

title: New French Interior Minister embodies the conservative right
summary: The 63-year-old conservative senator's stance on immigration has raised concerns among the left and migrant aid organizations.

title: Europe is considering what approach to take with Kais Saied's Tunisia
summary: As Tunisia's presidential election approaches, EU foreign policy chief Josep Borrell has presented a gloomy assessment of EU-Tunisia relations. However, Brussels intends to keep Tunis firmly tied to Europe.

title: Underestimated, poverty in Canada affects one in four people
summary: Since the end of the pandemic, poverty indicators have been on the rise again. Organizations and research institutes agree that the social safety net is failing.

title: Researchers studying catacomb remains hope to uncover the health secrets of past Parisians
summary: Since 2023, scientists have been analyzing some 10,000 bones underneath Paris's 14th arrondissement, following the collapse of a section of the bone wall.

title: Lebanon's Sidon population flee under Israeli bombings: 'It's a nightmare. We don't know where to go'
summary: In Sidon, city and provincial authorities were stunned by the scale of the disaster caused by Israeli strikes on southern Lebanon. In just one day, Israeli bombardments killed almost as many people as in a year of fighting, reviving memories of the 2006 war.

title: Paris trial linked to trafficking of child pornography images on Telegram opens
summary: Ten adults will be tried for managing and participating in channels on which they exchanged or sold content involving the rape of children.

title: New York's Flatiron Building may soon open its doors to its first residents
summary: Inaugurated in 1902, the building is a New York landmark and famous for its wedge-shape design that optimizes the space on which it stands. It's first apartments could be completed by 2026.

title: Sweden accuses Iran of cyberattack aimed at taking 'revenge' on Quran burning
summary: Around 15,000 messages 'calling for revenge' against desecrators of Islam's holy book were sent in the summer of 2023. Sweden's intelligence service determined that a hacker group had been acting 'on behalf of the Iranian Revolutionary Guard.'

title: The giant statues of Easter Island are threatened by climate change: 'We won't be able to protect them all'
summary: The moai, carved from volcanic tuff, are threatened by rising sea levels and climate changes worsened by global warming.

title: Estonia ramps up 'fortification' of its border with Russia
summary: In September, a new military base 30 kilometers from Russian territory was inaugurated. It will welcome American soldiers in the coming months.

title: Ghassan Salamé: 'Despite the seriousness of the situation in Gaza, the real focus of the conflict remains the West Bank'
summary: For over 20 years, Israel's elite was accustomed to the idea that it was preparing for the West Bank's annexation, with both the Israeli public's approval and the international community's complacency, says the Lebanese academic and diplomat in an interview.

title: United Nations: The tragic breakdown of multilateralism
summary: It's high time to revive the mechanisms that have seized up in an attempt to respond to the most devastating conflicts, notably in Ukraine and Gaza. The much-needed reform of the UN Security Council is, alas, in limbo.

title: Erdogan targets stray dogs in Turkey
summary: Passed this summer, the law intended by the Turkish president to regulate the proliferation of street dogs has provoked anger and criticism from animal rights activists, who see it as a 'license to kill.'

title: Ukraine and Russia negotiations: A long road riddled with pitfalls
summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky arrives at the UN General Assembly with a plan to put his country in a position of strength vis-à-vis Kremlin leader Vladimir Putin, with peace talks still a long way off.

title: Companies behind exploding pagers targeting Hezbollah members difficult to trace
summary: A week after thousands of pagers exploded in Lebanon, several front companies, from Hungary to Norway, are suspected of having played a role in this unprecedented operation.

title: These tiny crustaceans can find their caves in the dark
summary: At the end of each night, mysids return to their protective haven, guided by chemical signals.
